section.title: Introduction
section.para: This document helps anyone who wants to deploy OpenStack Grizzly for development purposes with Ubuntu 12.04 LTS (using the Ubuntu Cloud Archive)Fedora 18 (using the fedora-openstack-grizzly repo).

note.para: The Grizzly version is available on the current Ubuntu development series, which is 13.04 (Raring Ringtail) and the most recent LTS (Long Term Support) version which is 12.04 (Precise Pangolin), via the Ubuntu Cloud Archive. At this time, there are not packages available for 12.10.

section.para: We are going to install a three-node setup with one controller, one network and one compute node.
Of course, you can setup as many computes nodes as you want. This document is a good start for beginners in OpenStack who want to install a testing infrastructure.
